title: Warring Parties in Sudan to Hold Talks in Saudi Arabia
description: American officials say they hope representatives of two rival Sudanese generals will agree to an enduring cease-fire and to allowing humanitarian aid into the country.

title: Amid Blasts and Leadership Rifts, Growing Russian Unease Over War
description: With a Ukrainian offensive looming, explosions in Crimea and inside Russia have rattled Moscow, sparking bureaucratic infighting among military commanders.

title: The Next Fear on A.I.: Hollywood’s Killer Robots Become the Military’s Tools
description: U.S. national security officials are warning about the potential for the new technology to upend war, cyber conflict and — in the most extreme case — the use of nuclear weapons.

title: They refused to fight for Russia. The law did not treat them kindly.
description: Since Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine, hundreds of Russian men have faced criminal charges for becoming war refuseniks. That has not stopped others from going to unusual lengths to avoid battle.

title: Yevgeny Prigozhin Becomes a Player in Russia After Years in the Shadows
description: Yevgeny V. Prigozhin has used his leadership of the Wagner mercenary force and social media to turn brutality into a personal brand.

title: Jill Biden Greets Children and Veterans in London Ahead of King Charles Coronation
description: Dr. Biden attended several events on Friday with Akshata Murty, the wife of Britain’s prime minister, Rishi Sunak.

title: What I’m Reading: Coronation Edition
description: Royal bodies, royal traitors

title: What’s Behind Serbia’s Gun Violence
description: Serbia has one of the highest rates of gun ownership in the world, after the Balkan wars left the country awash in weapons.

title: Palestinians Demand Israel Hand Over Body of Prominent Prisoner
description: Israel’s refusal to hand over the remains of Khader Adnan has drawn scrutiny of the country’s practice of keeping bodies as leverage to bargain for Israeli remains.

title: Why Nearly All the King’s Realms Want to Say Goodbye and Good Riddance
description: Whether through a hard break or a soft fade in ties, nations that have kept the British monarch as their head of state are moving toward separation.

title: How 2 Students Rescued Dozens of People from the Fighting in Sudan
description: As feuding generals turned the Sudanese capital into a war zone, two university students navigated a battered Toyota through the chaos to rescue dozens of desperate people.

title: Ferdinand Habsburg Would Have Been King. Instead He’s a Racecar Driver.
description: If the Austro-Hungarian Empire still existed, 25-year-old Ferdinand Habsburg would eventually be its ruler. Instead he’s a racecar driver.

title: Where Should a King Sit? A 700-Year-Old Chair Will Do.
description: The Coronation Chair, on which King Charles III will sit for part of his ceremony on Saturday, is getting a touch-up. It hasn’t been used since Queen Elizabeth II’s coronation in 1953.

title: W.H.O. Ends Global Health Emergency Designation for Covid
description: The decision has little practical effect but is a significant moment in the struggle against a virus that has killed millions and upended lives throughout the world.

title: Queen Camilla and the Triumph of Image Transformation
description: After the death of Diana, Princess of Wales, there was a sense among many in Britain that “We can’t have Camilla.” But a successful branding overhaul has brought her a significant mark of acceptance.

title: Iraqi Man Accused of War Crimes Is Arrested in Belgium
description: The man is believed to have been part of a Qaeda terrorist cell that was partly responsible for bombings that killed at least 376 people in Iraq in 2009 and 2010.

title: Get Ready to See More of the Northern Lights
description: Over the past few months, viewings of the lights have increased in areas farther south than usual. That’s going to continue into 2025.

title: Ukraine wants to push forward. Black, soupy mud is making that difficult.
description: The unusually wet ground is one obstacle that the Ukrainian military, for all of its ingenuity, is finding difficult to overcome as it prepares for a counteroffensive against Russian forces.

title: Russian and Ukrainian Delegates Fight Over Ukrainian Flag at a Conference
description: Two altercations over Ukrainian flags occurred at a regional parliamentary conference in Ankara, the Turkish capital.

title: Strikes in Crimea Target Russian Logistics
description: Ukraine has not directly claimed responsibility for the attacks, which have increased in frequency. Military analysts say they could help set the stage for an expected counteroffensive.

title: ‘A Nightmare’
description: We explain the background of the military conflict in Sudan.

title: Wagner Group Chief Threatens to Pull Out of Bakhmut
description: Yevgeny V. Prigozhin, the Wagner group’s founder, named top Russian defense officials as responsible for the deaths of his fighters in the embattled eastern Ukrainian city.

title: Coronation Updates: U.K. Prepares for Crowning of King Charles III
description: The royal ceremony on Saturday, the first in 70 years, will aim to show the solidity of Britain, even as many in the country have met the coronation with indifference.

title: Prince Harry Is Attending the Coronation, but Meghan and Their Children Are Not
description: After years of family tensions, Prince Harry will attend his father’s coronation. But Harry’s wife, the Duchess of Sussex, is staying home in California with the couple’s children, Archie and Lilibet.

title: Who’s Attending King Charles III’s Coronation, and Who Isn’t
description: Royals from Europe and Asia plan to be there, as do Joanna Lumley and Nick Cave. President Biden does not.

title: Indian Olympians Persist in Demanding Arrest of Wrestling Chief
description: Athletes vow to continue a protest after a clash with the police, saying politicians are covering for an official accused of sexually harassing female wrestlers.

title: Schedule of Events for King Charles III Coronation Weekend
description: Three days of official festivities include the crowning of Charles and Camilla on Saturday, lunches and a concert on Sunday and volunteering on Monday.

title: The Dnipro River, Axis of Life and Death in Ukraine
description: The river has helped to define Ukraine’s history and culture, and remains vital to daily sustenance, even as it also serves as a front line in war — as it has countless times over thousands of years.

title: He’s 86 and Long Retired. Why Are Israelis Protesting Outside His Home?
description: Years ago, Aharon Barak helped shape Israel’s judicial system. Now the government wants to unravel his legacy, thrusting the retiree back into the spotlight.

title: As a King Is Crowned, Some Britons Ask Why the Monarchy Persists
description: As long as there has been a monarchy, there have been questions about its legitimacy. But for many people, it would be difficult to disentangle the royal family from British identity.

title: Iran Targets Businesses to Stop Women From Ignoring Hijab Law
description: As more Iranian women go without the head scarves mandated by law, efforts by the government to force businesses to promote compliance points to a growing struggle in the months ahead.

title: Early Results Show Tory Losses in England’s Local Elections
description: The Labour Party scored several significant victories in Conservative strongholds in votes viewed as a test of Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s popularity.

title: Australia vs. Warner Bros.?
description: The newest A.F.L. team will be in Tasmania. Can the club can be named after the island’s resident marsupial, the Tasmanian devil?

title: 8 Dead in Shooting in Serbia, Day After School Massacre That Killed 9
description: At least 10 additional people were wounded in the latest shooting, about 30 miles outside of Serbia’s capital, Belgrade.
